page.title: 04WOLD NEWTON VILLAGE (CONT)
page.content: {History.} {Tumuli}- many burial mounds within area dating back to {Neolithic}times.{Willy Howe}a prominent mound reputed to contain remains of a Saxon chieftain. Many {Bronze}and {Iron Age}relics found during normal farming activities. {Butt Hills}are near the village green and are archery practice butts from {Medieval}period.{Wold Newton Church} dates from{Norman}period with fine Norman doorway on south side.Font and chancel arch are notable features. Village previously named{Neutone}in Domesday Book, later {Newton Rochford} and finally present name. {Wold Newton Meteorite}-the village's main claim to fame! At 3.00pm on a misty winter afternoon in 1795 a meteorite fell in the south-west corner of the village.
